segments.text: I notice the woman drying dishes, completely unaware of the chaos around her.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The water is overflowing, and she’s just standing there, polishing that plate.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I see the boy on the stool, reaching for the cookie jar like it’s the most important thing in the world.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The girl is just waiting for him to hand her a cookie, completely oblivious to the danger.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I think the woman is going to be so angry when she finally notices the mess.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The stool is wobbling, and he’s just standing there like it’s nothing.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I wonder if the kids even care about the water all over the floor.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The whole scene is just a recipe for disaster, and no one is doing anything about it.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I feel like I should step in and stop them before someone gets hurt.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The water is just pouring and pouring, and the woman doesn’t even seem to notice.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I can’t believe how reckless everyone is being.
segments.speaker: PAR
